set1.ques: 1. Which of the following is black box testing?
set1.exp: Boundary value analysis is used in case design technique for black box testing.

set1.ques: 2. How is software reliability defined?
set1.exp: Software Reliability mainly concerned with the time component. Execution time of any sotware defined in software reliability.

set1.ques: 3. Identify the disadvantage of spiral model
set1.A: Doesn’t work well for smaller projects
set1.exp: All other options are the advantages of Spiral Model.
set1.D: Additional functionality can be added at a later date

set1.ques: 4. The testing in which code is checked
set1.exp: In white box testing internal component of software which means back end of software is checked.

set1.ques: 5. Which model can be selected if user is involved in all the phases of SDLC?
6. What kind of quality cost is incurred when an error is detected in a product prior to shipment?
set1.exp: This includes rework, repair, and failure mode analysis.

set1.ques: 7. Which of the following is a requirement management activity?
8. The process of each manager follows during the life of project is known as-
9. The degree to which the design specification are followed during manufacturing is known as-
10. Which is not the types of prototype model?
set1.exp: Their is no such thing as Diagonal Prototype whereas other options have their respective definitions.

set1.ques: 11. COCOMO model is use for-
set1.exp: COCOMO model used in software estimation model.

set1.ques: 12. What is DFD ?
set1.A: The modern version of flow chart
set1.B: Mainly used at system specification stage
set1.C: The primary output of the system design phase

set1.ques: 13. Most creative and challenging phase of system life cycle is-
set1.exp: System design is the most creative and challengiing phase of SDLC.

set1.ques: 14. Expantion of SRS is-
15. Decision support systems are used to-
set1.A: Evaluate and analyze the mission of organization

set1.ques: 16. A starting point in the design phase of a system design project is-
17. Cost of error correction is least at-
18. Prototype is a-
set1.exp: Prototype is a working model of existing system.

set1.ques: 19. The goal of modularization can be said to be-
set1.A: Produce systems that have stamp or data coupling between models
set1.B: Control and content coupling between models
set1.C: Control and data coupling between models
set1.D: Common and stamp coupling between models

set1.ques: 20. LOC in context to software engineering-

set2.ques: 1. What are the characteristics of Software?
set2.A: Software is developed or engineered, it is not manufactured in the classical sense.
set2.exp: Not Avilable
set2.C: Software can be custom-built or custom build

set2.ques: 2. What is the simplest model of software development paradigm?
set2.exp: Water fall model is the simplest model of software development paradigm.

set2.ques: 3. Project risk factor is considered in which model?
set2.exp: Spiral model is one of the most important Software Development Life Cycle models, which provides support for Risk Handling.

set2.ques: 4. Which software-end factors affecting maintenance cost?
set2.exp: Not Avilable

set2.ques: 5. Software as system with many components interacting with each other?
set2.exp: The architectural design is the highest abstract version of the system. It identifies the software as a system with many components interacting with each other.

set2.ques: 6. FAST stand for-
set2.exp: A team oriented approach is developed for needs gathering and is called facilitated application specification Techniques.

set2.ques: 7. COCOMO Stands for
set2.exp: The Constructive Cost Model (COCOMO) is a procedural software cost estimation model developed by Barry W. Boehm.

set2.ques: 8. What is the most common measure for correctness?
set2.exp: The most common measurement for correctness is defects per KLOC.

set2.ques: 9. Which of the following is not defined in a good software requirement specification (SRS) document?
set2.exp: Not Avilable

set2.ques: 10. Requirement engineering process includes which of these steps?
set2.exp: Requirement engineering process includes four steps which includes Feasibility study, Requirement gathering, Software Requirement specification & validation and software requirement management.

set2.ques: 11. Software Consists of –
set2.exp: Not Avilable

set2.ques: 12. SDLC stands for-
set2.exp: SDLC is a process used by the software industry to design, develop and test high quality software.

set2.ques: 13. Which one is not step requirement engineering?
set2.exp: Requirement Elicitation, Requirement Analysis, Requirement Documentation and Requirement Review are the four crucial process steps of requirement engineering.

set2.ques: 14. Functional testing is also known as :
set2.exp: Behavioural Testing is usually a functional testing.

set2.ques: 15. Patch is known as-
set2.exp: A software patch is an emergency fix which is worked upon the obsolete version whenever a vulnerability is encountered.

set2.ques: 16. Which is software process certification?
set2.exp: Not Avilable

set2.ques: 17. Effective software project management focuses on the Four P’s. Which are the Four P’s?
set2.exp: The management of software development is dependent on four factors : People, Product, Process and Project.

set2.ques: 18. Functional point can be calculated by
set2.exp: Function points=UFP*CAF where UFP =unadjusted function points CAF =complexity adjustment factor.

set2.ques: 19. An independently deliverable piece of functionality access to its services through interfaces is called
set2.exp: Not Avilable

set2.ques: 20. Unified process is maintained by
set2.exp: Not Avilable

set3.ques: 1. Software engineering approach is used to achieve.
set3.exp: Not Avilable

set3.ques: 2. Management of software development is dependent on
set3.exp: The management of software development is dependent on four factors : People, Product, Process and Project.

set3.ques: 3. UML stands for
set3.exp: In the field of software engineering UML is intended to provide a standard way to visualize the design of a system.

set3.ques: 4. Effort is measured in terms of-
set3.exp: The main cost of producing software is the manpower employed and the cost of developing software is generally measured in terms of person-months of effort spent in development.

set3.ques: 5. Which phase is not available in software life cycle ?
set3.exp: Software life cycle cosists of following phases Planning, Defining Requirements, Designing, Building, Testing, Deployment and Maintenance.

set3.ques: 6. Which one is the most important feature of spiral model ?
set3.exp: The most important feature of the spiral model is handling these unknown risks after the project has started.

set3.ques: 7. Waterfall model is not suitable for-
set3.exp: Waterfall model is not suitable for complex and object-oriented projects.

set3.ques: 8. Spiral model was developed by-
set3.exp: The spiral model in software engineering was first mentioned by Barry Boehm in his 1986 paper.

set3.ques: 9. The basic concepts of ER model are-
set3.exp: There are three basic elements in an ER Diagram: entity, attribute, relationship.

set3.ques: 10. Requirements elicitation means-
set3.exp: Requirements elicitation is a part of the requirements engineering process, usually followed by analysis and specification of the requirements.

set3.ques: 11. Which one is not a size measure for software-
set3.exp: Not Avilable

set3.ques: 12. COCOMO was developed initially by-
set3.exp: The Constructive Cost Model (COCOMO) is a procedural software cost estimation model developed by Barry W. Boehm.

set3.ques: 13. Cost estimation for a project may include
set3.exp: Not Avilable

set3.ques: 14. Functional testing is known as-
set3.exp: Behavioural Testing is usually a functional testing.

set3.ques: 15. A system that does not interact with internal environment is called-
set3.exp: An open system must interact with external environment. It receives inputs from and delivers outputs to the outside of the system.

set3.ques: 16. How many stages are in COCOMO-II
set3.exp: COCOMO II provides the following three-stage series of models for estimation of Application Generator, System Integration, and Infrastructure software projects.

set3.ques: 17. A node with indegree #0 and outdegree =0 is called
set3.exp: Not Avilable

set3.ques: 18. Alpha testing is done by ?
set3.exp: Alpha Testing is performed by the Testers within the organization.

set3.ques: 19. Acceptance testing is done by-
set3.exp: Acceptance testing (UAT) is a type of testing, which is done by the customer before accepting the final product.

set3.ques: 20. Cyclomatic complexity is developed by-
set3.exp: Cyclomatic complexity was developed by Thomas J. McCabe Sr. in 1976.
